description: From Ancient Greek σκλήρωσις (sklḗrōsis, “an induration”), from *σκληροῦν (sklēroûn, “to harden, indurate”), from σκληρός (sklērós, “hard”).

entries.meaning: (pathology) The abnormal hardening of body tissues, such as an artery; the appearance of hardenings, indurations, lesions, nodules.
Inability to create change or excessive resistance to change.
